octavia_load_balancer_create_description: With our Load Balancer service, you can securely and automatically balance the load on your application in real time, across multiple nodes. Depending on the needs of your application, you can choose from several modes, such as TCP, UDP or HTTP/S to balance the load of your application. For SSL/TLS certificates, we offer easy Let's Encrypt integration or you can also upload your own certificates.
octavia_load_balancer_create_size_title: Select the size of the Load Balancer
octavia_load_balancer_create_size_intro: Depending on your application's requirements in terms of network bandwidth, the number of requests per second or SSL connections, you can choose from different sizes of Load Balancer. Learn more about the capabilities of each size of Load Balancer
octavia_load_balancer_create_size_flavou: Suitable for small applications. Ideal for testing and development environments or for small projects.
Suitable for most projects handling average traffic.
When your application traffic reaches its highest density, you may need the best Load Balancer performance to handle it.
octavia_load_balancer_create_region_intr: Please select the Public Cloud region where your Load Balancer will be hosted. From the Public Cloud regions where a private network is defined, select the region where the Load Balancer will be hosted. Can't find the region you want in the list? To learn more about feature availability by region,
octavia_load_balancer_create_floating_ip: To receive public traffic, you need to attach a Floating IP to your Load Balancer
Your Floating IP will be created at the end of the configuration process.
The new Floating IP will be charged at {{price}}
By choosing not to attach any Public IPs, your Load Balancer will only be accessible from a private network.
octavia_load_balancer_create_private_net: Configure the private network your Load Balancer will be hosted on: if you want a Floating IP to be associated with your Load Balancer, the subnet must have an IP gateway
Le réseau privé sélectionné n'a pas de subnet ayant une gateway ip définie: choisissez ou Créez un autre réseau privé.
We have detected that a gateway is missing on the private network/selected subnet. We will create one for you when you create the load balancer
octavia_load_balancer_create_instance_in: To configure your Load Balancer, define your front-ends with a port and a protocol. Then assign it to a pool of instances (back ends) that can be reached on a specific port and protocol. If you have multiple protocols and/or ports per instance, you can configure multiple pools per listener by referring to the documentation
octavia_load_balancer_create_instance_ba: You can add up to {{maxListeners}} listeners with a maximum of {{maxInstances}} instances in this wizard. For more options or to edit more advanced features (such as proxy protocols, health check, or L7 policies), switch to edit mode.
You can enter members via IP after creating your Load Balancer in the members section of the Pool view
octavia_load_balancer_create_banner: Your Load Balancer is being created. This will only take a few minutes.
octavia_load_balancer_create_instance_ba: In this first integration of the Load Balancer in the OVHcloud Control Panel, the Health Monitors can only be configured when the Load Balancer is created.
